text: I previously had a disappointing experience with one of the cashiers, a typical auntie. The service was not only rude, but I also overheard her gossiping incessantly with her colleagues, all while pretending to be friendly at the same time. Hypocrite! What a shame to tarnish the reputation of such a well-known brand. Fortunately, she isn't assigned to any of the larger stores in the mall.

just like its name, their price were quite fair. lots of daily needs (food, toiletry, etc) and some of them are their own brand.
staff also nice. and it used automatic payment machine (insert your money and you'll get your change if any). yeah my first time shopping in FairPrice

Very small outlet - it is the smallest NTUC FairPrice outlet I have ever been to so obviously does not carry many other groceries and items as most FairPrice outlets but still have the bare basic necessities. The size is approximately three 7-Eleven convenience store. Am quite surprised that FairPrice does not have a bigger outlet here as the Bendemeer estate has a lot of residents.

The manager and the staff are very helpful when my mother carelessly dropped her CDC vouchers in the shop. They are empathetic and the lady Filipino manager handles the verification process professionally to avoid scams. Appreciate the effort.
The shop is small in size compared to most NTUC outlets because it's more of a franchise shop like some NTUC Cheers outlet. However, I have also observed that most of the staffs and manager working there are very patient with elderly at the cashier counters, especially during long queues.
As this is a mature estate with a lot of elderly, their attitude is worth the compliment.
If you have no patience during payment queues, I will advise you to buy at other places.
This is nearest NTUC and friendly staffs are very helpful to customers and every one feel very comfortable and üè† homely
